channel.title: Abstraction
channel.copyright: Abstraction is a computer science club at Calvin University that serves students interested in computer science.Mailing List

item.title: Game Development: Best Practices and How I Learned Them the Hard Way
item.description: SPEAKER: Andrew Quist WHEN: March 19 at 6:30pm LOCATION: ONLINE on Teams at https://bit.ly/3tnXiGJ Details Calvin graduate and game developer Andrew Quist will be discussing his journey in game development and sharing some best practices.

item.title: Talk
item.description: Writing a Platformer in HTML5 and JavaScript by Jason Pruim WHEN: February 20 at 3:00pm LOCATION: ONLINE on Microsoft Teams at https://bit.ly/3ptVhGB Details We’ll be discussing how a simple web game written in JavaScript and HTML5 is constructed, and provide a basic starting point for you to build your own. Talk Resources https://github.com/Calvin-Abstraction/html5-games

item.title: Self Promotion
item.description: Are you a Calvin student with a project you would like to promote? Contact us if you think it’ll benefit others to share. We don’t guarantee to list you project, but if we do you’ll find it here.

item.title: 2021 Opportunities Index
item.description: <- Go to 2021s Main Page Go to Resources Page -> An index where you can learn about the opportunities and activities offered by Abstraction and the computer science department at Calvin. Talks We are planning to have around 4-6 talks in the spring. To stay informed about upcoming talks, please subscribe to the Abstraction mailing list (this is not the GNU Mailman abstraction-news list). Febuary 20, 2021 at 3:00pm - by Jason P.

item.title: 2021 Resources Index
item.description: <- Go to 2021s Main Page Go to Oppertunities Page -> An index where you can learn about the resources for C.S. at Calvin. Whether hardware or the people who make things work, we hope to make this index all-inclusive. Physical Computers Please subscribe to the Abstraction mailing list (this is not the GNU Mailman abstraction-news list). Links Email us links. https://missing.csail.mit.edu/ The Missing Semester of Your CS Education GitHub Student Developer Pack Companies want your eyes!

item.title: About
item.description: Our Mission We exist to serve the community of Calvin students interested in computer science. We currently serve in a few ways. We provide opportunities by hosting talks and promoting jobs and internships for the community to grow. We provide resources in the forms of people, hardware, software. We provide a platform to help grow the C.S. community at Calvin. Joining Abstraction Welcome! Other than subscribing to our emailing list, there are no formal membership procedures to join Abstraction.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact us at abstraction@calvin.edu. . Sometimes you may have better luck with one of our personal emails: Contact David at dar23 at students. calvin . edu Or Aaron at alb83 at students . …. . edu

item.title: Leadership
